company.name: Fantage.com, Inc.
company.address: 400 Kelby Street, 19th Floor, Fort Lee, New Jersey 07024
company.business_description: Fantage.com, Inc. developed and operates a massively multiplayer online role-playing game directed at children ages 6-16.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Fantage.com operated an online role-playing game directed at children ages 6-16. The company self-certified to the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework in June 2011 but failed to renew its certification in June 2012. Despite its certification status becoming 'not current,' Fantage continued to represent on its website that it followed the Safe Harbor Framework privacy principles from June 2012 until January 2014, a period of approximately 19 months.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework by stating it follows the privacy principles of the framework when collecting personal information from EU residents
representations_made.quoted_text: When we collect personal information from residents of the European Union, we follow the privacy principles of the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework, which covers the transfer, collection, use, and retention of personal data from the European Union.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claim
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it is a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: From June 2012 until January 2014 respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 12 was false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Fantage.com, Inc. and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, compliance with, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any privacy or security program, including Safe Harbor Frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection all documents relating to compliance with this order for a period of five years.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection a print or electronic copy of all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of this order to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days

requirements.description: Deliver this order to future personnel within thirty days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in

requirements.description: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten days prior to the change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this

requirements.description: Secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section
requirements.quoted_text: structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, such as dissolution, merger, sale, or bankruptcy filing.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action resulting in a successor corporation; creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate; proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or change in corporate name or address
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: With respect to any proposed change in the corporation about which respondent learns fewer than thirty days prior to the date such action is to take place, notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file with the Commission a true and accurate written report detailing its compliance with this order within sixty days, and submit additional reports upon request.

requirements.description: File with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission,

requirements.description: Submit an additional true and accurate written report within ten days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on June 19, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
